snippet: Just as confidence had been rising among Mitt Romney and his aides that they could pull off a win in Iowa, Rick Santorum emerged as the latest in a rotating cast of surging alternatives.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum emerges as the latest in a rotating cast of surging alternatives to Mitt Romney days before the Iowa caucuses, just as Romney seeks to convert his tentative standing in the polls into a first-place finish; outcome of the caucuses could be an indicator of whether Romney is succeeding in rallying conservatives behind him or whether he faces months of struggle to win delegates and resolve the rifts within the Republican Party.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jill Abramson from Council Bluffs, Iowa, and Michael Barbaro and Sarah Wheaton from Des Moines.

lead_paragraph: Just as confidence had been rising among Mitt Romney and his aides that they could pull off a win in Iowa, Rick Santorum emerged as the latest in a rotating cast of surging alternatives.

headline.seo: In Iowa, Romney Fights to Become Caucus Favorite
headline.main: Romney Fights for First-Place Showing in Iowa Caucuses
headline.print_headline: In Iowa, Romney Fights to Become Caucus Favorite
